summary: This bill, the Death Tax Repeal Act of 2025, aims to repeal the estate and generation-skipping transfer taxes. It amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to eliminate these taxes and makes modifications to the gift tax, including changes to the tax computation, treatment of transfers in trust, and the lifetime gift exemption. The bill also includes provisions for inflation adjustments and conforming amendments, and specifies effective dates and transition rules.
